neighbors.name: Jason & Tracy Thornock
neighbors.claims: Jason and Tracy Thornock own a third-generation cattle and hay ranch in Cokeville, Lincoln County, Wyoming ([Inside Climate News](https://insideclimatenews.org/news/14122025/cokeville-wyoming-ranch-scale-solar/)). Jason Thornock has publicly advocated for ranch-scale solar to offset an approximately $150,000 annual electric bill, testifying to the state legislature about the benefits of net metering and criticizing the utility as a 'government-protected monopoly' ([Wyoming Public Media](https://www.wyomingpublicmedia.org/natural-resources-energy/2025-12-17/ranchers-hoping-solar-can-lower-costs-say-utilities-and-the-state-stand-in-their-way)). In 2016, the Wyoming Supreme Court affirmed a district court ruling denying the Thornocks' request for a private road across neighboring land, finding they already had adequate access via a public road ([Justia](https://law.justia.com/cases/wyoming/supreme-court/2016/s-15-0273.html)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Jason on energy independence. Acknowledge his legislative testimony regarding net metering and emphasize how this project aligns with his goal of reducing utility monopoly control and lowering agricultural operating costs.

citations.claim: Own a third-generation cattle and hay ranch in Cokeville, Lincoln County, Wyoming
citations.title: Wyoming Ranchers Hoping Solar Can Lower Costs Say Utilities and the State Stand in Their Way

citations.claim: Advocated for ranch-scale solar to offset $150,000 bill and criticized utility monopoly
citations.title: Ranchers hoping solar can lower costs say utilities and the state stand in their way

citations.claim: Wyoming Supreme Court affirmed denial of private road request in 2016
citations.title: Thornock v. Esterholdt, 2016 WY 129

neighbors.name: Justin & Jamie Mckinnon
neighbors.claims: Justin and Jamie Mckinnon operate McKinnon Livestock, a cattle ranch business based in Cokeville, Wyoming ([Buzzfile](https://www.buzzfile.com/business/McKinnon-Livestock-307-279-2177)). Justin Mckinnon serves as the Vice President of the Cokeville Stock and Saddle Club, a key local organization that manages the annual rodeo ([Cokeville Rodeo](https://www.cokevillerodeo.com/)). USDA records indicate that Justin Mckinnon received approximately $228,600 in federal farm subsidies from 1995 to 2024, reflecting the familyâ€™s active ranch operations ([EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?z=1&zip=83114&page=0)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Vice President of Cokeville Stock and Saddle Club

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect via his leadership role in the Stock and Saddle Club. Emphasize respect for ranching traditions and how the project supports the local agricultural economy without interfering with livestock operations or rodeo events.

citations.claim: Serves as Vice President of the Cokeville Stock and Saddle Club
citations.title: Cokeville Rodeo - Meet Our Team

citations.claim: Received approximately $228,600 in federal farm subsidies 1995-2024
citations.title: EWG Farm Subsidy Database Search Results

neighbors.name: Monte Mckinnon
neighbors.claims: Monte Mckinnon is a long-time resident of Cokeville, listed as an alumnus of Cokeville High School ([Old Friends](https://old-friends.co/school.php?s=37752)). The Mckinnon family has a documented presence in the community dating back to at least the 1920s ([Genealogy Trails](http://genealogytrails.com/wyo/lincoln/cokevillecem.html)). Public records confirm his past residency at addresses within Cokeville ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/m/monte-mckinnon/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Long-time resident; no public leadership found

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with deference to his seniority in the community. Focus on preserving the quiet, rural character of the area and ensuring the project respects the long-standing history of local families like the Mckinnons.

citations.claim: Past residency at addresses within Cokeville
citations.title: Monte Mckinnon Residential History
